result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Harold Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges, to include victim witness surcharges. To be colected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.   Remaining balance to be paid by 6/19/2018.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  To be served in Wisconsin State Prison system.  Straight time, forthwith.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Harold Robinson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 5 months in the House of Correction, to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System, consecutive to any other sentence.  Sentence to be served straight time, forthwith.
-Pay MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges; to include the victim/witness and DNA surcharges, to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, remaining balance is to be paid by 6/19/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample.
-Restitution set at zero
-6 month drivers license suspension consecutive to any other suspension.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Joshua Harold Robinson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Joshua Harold Robinson in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached an agreement. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire, Addendum, and Jury Instructions/Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Joshua Harold Robinson not in court, in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 6/18/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 05/01/2015 received and filed. (11 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Stephen Sargent, Milwaukee Office of the State Public Defender, 819 North 6th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53233.

Defendant Joshua Harold Robinson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Joshua Harold Robinson in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #06CF6274 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:David Kritzeck-MPD Officer.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Joshua Harold Robinson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Joshua Harold Robinson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
April 23, 2015 @ 8:30A in In Custody Intake, CJF Rm 137A of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.
